modules.name: responsible_ai_conceptual_foundations_methods_and_applications
recommendedLiterature: Voeneky, S., P. Kellmeyer, O. Mueller, and W. Burgard, ed. 2022. The Cambridge Handbook of Responsible Artificial Intelligence: Interdisciplinary Perspectives. Cambridge Law Handbooks. Cambridge: Cambridge University Press.
Coeckelbergh, Mark. AI ethics. (2020). The MIT Press.
Heilinger, J.-C. (2022). The Ethics of AI Ethics. A Constructive Critique. Philosophy & Technology, 35(3), 61.
McLennan, S., et al. (2022). Embedded ethics: A proposal for integrating ethics into the development of medical AI. BMC Medical Ethics, 23(1), 6.
Schmitt, L. (2021). Mapping global AI governance: A nascent regime in a fragmented landscape. AI and Ethics.
furtherModules: Follow-up (block) seminar planned for summer semester 2024
